card.name: Abattoir Ghoul
card.ability:
First strike
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Abattoir Ghoul this turn dies, you gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
card.flavor: Death took his humanity but not his skill with the knife.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : You'll gain life equal to the creature's last known toughness before it died. For example, if Abattoir Ghoul deals 3 first-strike damage to a 7/7 creature and then you give the creature -5/-5 before the regular combat damage step, you'll gain 2 life.

card.name: Abbey Griffin
card.ability: Flying, vigilance
card.flavor:
"The darkness crawls with vampires and ghouls, but we are not without allies."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch

card.name: Altar's Reap
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Altar's Reap, sacrifice a creature.
Draw two cards.
card.flavor:
"The demons don't care if we mutter niceties and act out ceremonies. Just kill him."
—Bishop Volpaig, servant of Griselbrand
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : You can't sacrifice more than one creature to cast Altar's Reap.
9/22/2011 : You sacrifice a creature when you pay other costs to cast Altar's Reap. The creature will already be in its owner's graveyard by the time any player gets a chance to respond.
4/15/2013 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
4/15/2013 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

card.name: Ambush Viper
card.ability:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
card.flavor:
"Living creatures seldom impress me. But I like this one."
—Uta Falkenrath

card.name: Ancient Grudge
card.ability:
Destroy target artifact.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: If there's anything a werewolf hates, it's a collar—especially Avacyn's Collar, the symbol of her church.

card.name: Angel of Flight Alabaster
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, return target Spirit card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: She endures without Avacyn but secretly asks each soul she guides if it has seen her.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : The Spirit card must already be in your graveyard when the ability triggers at the beginning of your upkeep. If there is no Spirit card in your graveyard when your upkeep begins, the ability will be removed from the stack with no effect.

card.name: Angelic Overseer
card.ability:
Flying
As long as you control a Human, Angelic Overseer has hexproof and is indestructible.
card.flavor: From mortal hope immortal power springs.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : If you control a Human, and an effect tries to destroy each Human you control and Angelic Overseer simultaneously, Angelic Overseer won't be destroyed.
9/22/2011 : If you control a Human, and lethal damage is dealt to Angelic Overseer, that damage will remain marked on it that turn. If later in the turn you no longer control a Human, Angelic Overseer will be destroyed.

card.name: Armored Skaab
card.ability: When Armored Skaab enters the battlefield, put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard.
card.flavor: Literally made for battle.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : If you have fewer than four cards in your library when Armored Skaab enters the battlefield, you'll put all of them into your graveyard.

card.name: Army of the Damned
card.ability:
Put thirteen 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens onto the battlefield tapped.
Flashback {7}{B}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: Sometimes death comes knocking. Sometimes it tears down the walls.

card.name: Ashmouth Hound
card.ability: Whenever Ashmouth Hound blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Ashmouth Hound deals 1 damage to that creature.
card.flavor: Its fiery paws make it easy to track, which is very useful when you want to go in exactly the opposite direction.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : Ashmouth Hound's ability triggers once for each creature it blocks or becomes blocked by.

card.name: Avacynian Priest
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Tap target non-Human creature.
card.flavor: Moorlanders speak in awe of the priests' talent for arriving just in time to drive off the wicked things that prowl the ravished parish.

card.name: Avacyn's Pilgrim
card.ability: {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "Avacyn's protection is everywhere. From the holy church to the sacred glade, all that we see is under her blessed watch."

card.name: Back from the Brink
card.ability: Exile a creature card from your graveyard and pay its mana cost: Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.flavor: On Innistrad, death is just a career change.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : Although you're paying the card's mana cost, you aren't casting that card. Abilities that reduce the cost to cast a creature spell won't apply, and additional costs to cast that creature can't be paid. If the card has an ability that allows another cost to be paid "rather than its mana cost," that alternative cost can be paid. Other alternative costs that affect what it costs to cast a creature spell, such as evoke, can't.
9/22/2011 : Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the creature will trigger when the token enters the battlefield. Any "as [this creature] enters the battlefield" or "[this creature] enters the battlefield with" abilities of the creature will also work.
9/22/2011 : If you exile a double-faced creature card this way, you'll pay the mana cost of the front face. The token will be a copy of the front face and it won't be able to transform.
9/22/2011 : If the exiled creature card has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be zero.

card.name: Balefire Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Balefire Dragon deals combat damage to a player, it deals that much damage to each creature that player controls.
card.flavor: If it comes for you, die boldly or die swiftly—for die you will.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : The damage dealt by Balefire Dragon's triggered ability isn't combat damage.

card.name: Bane of Hanweir
card.ability:
Bane of Hanweir attacks each turn if able.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Bane of Hanweir.

card.name: Battleground Geist
card.ability:
Flying
Other Spirit creatures you control get +1/+0.
card.flavor: Not content to nudge vases and chill drawing rooms, some geists muster spectral armies to claw at the hearts of the living.

card.name: Bitterheart Witch
card.ability:
Deathtouch
When Bitterheart Witch dies, you may search your library for a Curse card, put it onto the battlefield attached to target player, then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : The Curse must be legally able to enchant the player. For example, if the player has protection from red, you couldn't put a red Curse onto the battlefield this way.

card.name: Blasphemous Act
card.ability:
Blasphemous Act costs {1} less to cast for each creature on the battlefield.
Blasphemous Act deals 13 damage to each creature.
card.flavor:
"Holy places are no longer sanctuary from death, and death is no longer sanctuary from anything."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : The total cost to cast Blasphemous Act is locked in before you pay that cost. For example, if there are three creatures on the battlefield, including one you can sacrifice to add {1} to your mana pool, the total cost of Blasphemous Act is {5}{R}. Then you can sacrifice the creature when you activate mana abilities just before paying the cost.
9/22/2011 : Blasphemous Act's ability can't reduce the total cost to cast the spell below {R}.
9/22/2011 : Although players may respond to Blasphemous Act once it's been cast, once it's announced, they can't respond before the cost is calculated and paid.

card.name: Blazing Torch
card.ability:
Equipped creature can't be blocked by Vampires or Zombies.
Equipped creature has "{T}, Sacrifice Blazing Torch: Blazing Torch deals 2 damage to target creature or player."
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : If a Blazing Torch controlled by one player somehow winds up equipping a creature a different player controls, the damage ability can't be activated by either player. Only the creature's controller may activate the ability -- but since that player can't sacrifice Blazing Torch (a permanent he or she doesn't control), the ability's cost can't be paid.
10/1/2009 : The source of the damage is Blazing Torch, not the equipped creature. However, the equipped creature's ability is what targets the creature or player. If Blazing Torch is equipped to a red creature, for example, the ability couldn't target a creature with protection from red. It could target a creature with protection from artifacts, but all the damage would be prevented.

card.name: Bloodcrazed Neonate
card.ability:
Bloodcrazed Neonate attacks each turn if able.
Whenever Bloodcrazed Neonate deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor: While elder vampires select their meals with care, the newly sired frenzy at the first whiff.

card.name: Bloodgift Demon
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, target player draws a card and loses 1 life.
card.flavor: He relishes the devotion of his Skirsdag puppets and their belief that it will earn them immortality.

card.name: Bloodline Keeper
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Put a 2/2 black Vampire creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
{B}: Transform Bloodline Keeper. Activate this ability only if you control five or more Vampires.

card.name: Bonds of Faith
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as it's a Human. Otherwise, it can't attack or block.
card.flavor:
"What cannot be destroyed will be bound."
—Oath of Avacyn
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : Once the enchanted creature has been declared as an attacking or blocking creature, causing it to stop being a Human won't remove it from combat. It will lose the +2/+2 bonus, however.

card.name: Boneyard Wurm
card.ability: Boneyard Wurm's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
card.flavor: The only thing it likes more than discovering a pit of bones is adding to it.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : The ability that defines Boneyard Wurm's power and toughness works in all zones, not just the battlefield. If Boneyard Wurm is in your graveyard, it will count itself.

card.name: Brain Weevil
card.ability:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Sacrifice Brain Weevil: Target player discards two cards. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

card.name: Bramblecrush
card.ability: Destroy target noncreature permanent.
card.flavor:
"Civilization is fertilizer."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

card.name: Brimstone Volley
card.ability:
Brimstone Volley deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Morbid — Brimstone Volley deals 5 damage to that creature or player instead if a creature died this turn.

card.name: Bump in the Night
card.ability:
Target opponent loses 3 life.
Flashback {5}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: It's not just the wind. It's not all in your head. And it's definitely something to worry about.

card.name: Burning Vengeance
card.ability: Whenever you cast a spell from your graveyard, Burning Vengeance deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Mist is the geists' sorrow. Wind is their pain. Fire is their vengeance.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : Although flashback is the most common way to cast a spell from your graveyard, Burning Vengeance will trigger whenever you cast a spell from your graveyard through any means.
9/22/2011 : Burning Vengeance won't trigger when you activate an ability of a card in your graveyard such as unearth or the ability of Reassembling Skeleton.
9/22/2011 : Burning Vengeance's triggered ability will resolve before the spell you cast from your graveyard.

card.name: Butcher's Cleaver
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0.
As long as equipped creature is a Human, it has lifelink.
Equip {3}
card.flavor: Outside the safety of Thraben, there is little distinction between tool and weapon.

card.name: Cackling Counterpart
card.ability:
Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of target creature you control.
Flashback {5}{U}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : The token copies exactly what was printed on the original creature and nothing else (unless that creature is copying something else or is a token; see below). It doesn't copy whether that creature is tapped or untapped, whether it has any counters on it or Auras and Equipment attached to it, or any non-copy effects that have changed its power, toughness, types, color, or so on.
9/22/2011 : If you copy a double-faced creature, the token will be a copy of the face that's up when the token is created. Because the token is not a double-faced card, it won't be able to transform.
9/22/2011 : If the copied creature has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be zero.
9/22/2011 : If the copied creature is copying something else (for example, if the copied creature is an Evil Twin), then the token enters the battlefield as whatever that creature copied.
9/22/2011 : If the copied creature is a token, the token that's created copies the original characteristics of that token as stated by the effect that put the token onto the battlefield.
9/22/2011 : Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the copied creature will trigger when the token enters the battlefield. Any "as [this creature] enters the battlefield" or "[this creature] enters the battlefield with" abilities of the chosen creature will also work.

card.name: Caravan Vigil
card.ability:
Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
Morbid — You may put that card onto the battlefield instead of putting it into your hand if a creature died this turn.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : You can choose to put the basic land card into your hand even if a creature died the turn you cast Caravan Vigil.

card.name: Cellar Door
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Target player puts the bottom card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If it's a creature card, you put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: As if anyone needed another reason to avoid dark, dank cellars.

card.name: Champion of the Parish
card.ability: Whenever another Human enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Champion of the Parish.
card.flavor: "I stand for every cobbler, tanner, and fool in this town—and they stand for me."

card.name: Chapel Geist
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Death has bound it with chains of past regrets. Forever it searches for atonement, each kindness removing a single link.

card.name: Charmbreaker Devils
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, return an instant or sorcery card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Charmbreaker Devils gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : The instant or sorcery card returned to your hand is chosen at random as the triggered ability resolves. If any player responds to the ability, that player won't yet know what card will be returned.
9/22/2011 : Because the first ability doesn't target the instant or sorcery card, any instants or sorceries put into your graveyard in response to that ability may be returned to your hand.

card.name: Civilized Scholar
card.ability: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card. If a creature card is discarded this way, untap Civilized Scholar, then transform it.

card.name: Claustrophobia
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When Claustrophobia enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
card.flavor: Six feet of earth muffled his cries.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : Claustrophobia can target and enchant an untapped creature.
9/22/2011 : The enchanted creature can still be untapped in other ways, such as by Village Bell-Ringer's ability.

card.name: Clifftop Retreat
card.ability:
Clifftop Retreat enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Mountain or a Plains.
{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Where cathars learn to fight not only demons and vampires, but ignorance as well.

card.name: Cloistered Youth
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may transform Cloistered Youth.

card.name: Cobbled Wings
card.ability:
Equipped creature has flying.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
card.flavor: For the necro-alchemist, any puzzle can be solved with intelligence and harvested body parts.

card.name: Corpse Lunge
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Corpse Lunge, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Corpse Lunge deals damage equal to the exiled card's power to target creature.

card.name: Creeping Renaissance
card.ability:
Choose a permanent type. Return all cards of the chosen type from your graveyard to your hand.
Flashback {5}{G}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : The permanent types are artifact, creature, enchantment, land, and planeswalker.

card.name: Creepy Doll
card.ability:
Creepy Doll is indestructible.
Whenever Creepy Doll deals combat damage to a creature, flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy that creature.
card.flavor: A child's porcelain doll went missing one night, as did a pair of kitchen shears and the town magistrate.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : You don't flip the coin until the ability resolves. If you want to respond to the ability, perhaps by regenerating the damaged creature, you'll have to do so before you know the outcome of the flip.
9/22/2011 : If the combat damage Creepy Doll deals to a creature is lethal, you'll still flip a coin. If the creature is still on the battlefield (perhaps because it regenerated), it could be destroyed a second time, depending on the coin flip.

card.name: Crossway Vampire
card.ability: When Crossway Vampire enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.
card.flavor: "Do not flatter Fate. It did not guide you into my clutches tonight. That was all my doing."

card.name: Curiosity
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: "Surely you know the joy of the hunt, my furry friend. My kind of hunt just takes a different form than yours."
card.ruling:
2/1/2007 : You draw one card each time the enchanted creature damages the opponent. This is not one card per point of damage.
2/1/2007 : If put on your opponent's creature, you do not draw a card when that creature damages you. The creature has to damage your opponent in order to have this work.
2/1/2007 : Drawing a card is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later and do it, even if it is something you normally do.
9/22/2011 : "You" refers to the controller of Curiosity, which may be different from the controller of the enchanted creature."An opponent" refers to an opponent of Curiosity's controller.
9/22/2011 : Any damage dealt by the enchanted creature to an opponent will cause Curiosity to trigger, not just combat damage.
9/22/2011 : Curiosity doesn't trigger if the enchanted creature deals damage to a planeswalker controlled by an opponent.

card.name: Curse of Death's Hold
card.ability:
Enchant player
Creatures enchanted player controls get -1/-1.
card.flavor: "May you and all your kin waste and wither until your clan is no more!"

card.name: Curse of Oblivion
card.ability:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, that player exiles two cards from his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: The first step to peace is to learn how to forget.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : If the enchanted player has only one card in his or her graveyard, he or she exiles that card.

card.name: Curse of Stalked Prey
card.ability:
Enchant player
Whenever a creature deals combat damage to enchanted player, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
card.flavor:
"Innocent thorns can fill the air with your bloodscent. Don't stray from the path."
—Elmut, crossway watcher
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : The ability will trigger when any creature deals combat damage to the enchanted player, including one controlled by another opponent or even by the enchanted player (if combat damage gets redirected somehow).

card.name: Curse of the Bloody Tome
card.ability:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, that player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: After seeing his life's work drip away, the mage decided it was a good time to go crazy.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : If the enchanted player has only one card in his or her library, he or she puts that card into his or her graveyard.

card.name: Curse of the Nightly Hunt
card.ability:
Enchant player
Creatures enchanted player controls attack each turn if able.
card.flavor: When the moon rises and the bloodlust takes hold, nothing matters but the kill.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : The enchanted player still chooses which player or planeswalker each creature he or she controls attacks.
9/22/2011 : If there are multiple combat phases in a turn, each creature must attack only in the first one in which it's able to.
9/22/2011 : If, during the enchanted player's declare attackers step, a creature he or she controls is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or hasn't been under that player's control continuously since the turn began (and doesn't have haste), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having the creature attack, the player isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

card.name: Curse of the Pierced Heart
card.ability:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, Curse of the Pierced Heart deals 1 damage to that player.
card.flavor:
"May your veins weep, and may every vampire take notice."
—Stensian curse

card.name: Darkthicket Wolf
card.ability: {2}{G}: Darkthicket Wolf gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor: Werewolf slayers don't know for certain how werewolves are created. So they kill all the wolves, just to be safe.

card.name: Daybreak Ranger
card.ability:
{T}: Daybreak Ranger deals 2 damage to target creature with flying.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Daybreak Ranger.

card.name: Dead Weight
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.
card.flavor: The crueler vampires' idea of free-range farming.

card.name: Dearly Departed
card.ability:
Flying
As long as Dearly Departed is in your graveyard, each Human creature you control enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor:
"Never forget our ancestors. They have not forgotten us."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : The effect is cumulative. Human creatures you control will enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter for each Dearly Departed in your graveyard.
9/22/2011 : In most cases, when determining whether a creature entering the battlefield under your control should get a +1/+1 counter, you'll simply look at what the creature will look like on the battlefield. You'll consider any effects affecting a creature entering the battlefield under your control that fall under one of these categories:--Replacement effects that have already modified how the permanent enters the battlefield, like the one created by Clone.--Continuous effects that changed the permanent's creature type on the stack, like the one created by Artificial Evolution.--Effects from the permanent's own static abilities, as long as they affect only that permanent, like Adaptive Automaton's.
9/22/2011 : However, you'll ignore the continuous effects of static abilities that come from other sources. For example, if you control Xenograft with Human as the chosen creature type, a Vampire creature would not enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter.

card.name: Delver of Secrets
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top card of your library. You may reveal that card. If an instant or sorcery card is revealed this way, transform Delver of Secrets.

card.name: Demonmail Hauberk
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +4/+2.
Equip—Sacrifice a creature.
card.flavor: It comes off as easily as your own skin.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : You can sacrifice the creature Demonmail Hauberk is equipping in order to equip it to another creature.

card.name: Deranged Assistant
card.ability: {T}, Put the top card of your library into your graveyard: Add {1} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "Garl, adjust the slurry dispensers. Garl, fetch more corpses. Garl, quit crying and give me your brain tissue. If he doesn't stop being so rude, I'm quitting."

card.name: Desperate Ravings
card.ability:
Draw two cards, then discard a card at random.
Flashback {2}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: Her mind was quite gone, yet she spoke nothing but truth.

card.name: Devil's Play
card.ability:
Devil's Play deals X damage to target creature or player.
Flashback {X}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: A devil's hands are never idle.

card.name: Diregraf Ghoul
card.ability: Diregraf Ghoul enters the battlefield tapped.
card.flavor:
"At least this one still has arms and legs. Well, most of its legs."
—Enslow, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

card.name: Disciple of Griselbrand
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.
card.flavor: The demon Griselbrand dared to stand against Avacyn, earning him the loathing of thousands and the admiration of a few.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : The amount of life you gain is equal to the toughness of the creature as it last existed on the battlefield, not its toughness in the graveyard.

card.name: Dissipate
card.ability: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.
card.flavor:
"This abomination never belonged in our world. I'm merely setting it free."
—Dierk, geistmage
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The card does not go to the graveyard before being exiled.
10/4/2004 : If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then it does not get exiled.

card.name: Divine Reckoning
card.ability:
Each player chooses a creature he or she controls. Destroy the rest.
Flashback {5}{W}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: Survival of the purest.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : Starting with the player whose turn it is, each player chooses a creature in turn order. Players will know the choice of each player who chose before them.

card.name: Doomed Traveler
card.ability: When Doomed Traveler dies, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: He vowed he would never rest until he reached his destination. He doesn't know how right he was.

card.name: Dream Twist
card.ability:
Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Flashback {1}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Elder Cathar
card.ability: When Elder Cathar dies, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. If that creature is a Human, put two +1/+1 counters on it instead.
card.flavor: "My greatest hope is that you will surpass me in every way, consigning my name to some forgotten corner of history."

card.name: Elder of Laurels
card.ability: {3}{G}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creatures you control.
card.flavor: Hopes and prayers can carry the same force as swords and torches.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : The number of creatures you control is counted as the ability resolves.
9/22/2011 : Once the ability has resolved, the bonus won't change if the number of creatures you control changes later in the turn.

card.name: Elite Inquisitor
card.ability:
First strike, vigilance
Protection from Vampires, from Werewolves, and from Zombies
card.flavor: "No matter how many I kill, there are always more to hunt. It makes me smile just to think about it."

card.name: Endless Ranks of the Dead
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, put X 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is half the number of Zombies you control, rounded down.
card.flavor: With Thraben's army recalled to its city walls, outlying villages were left to fend for themselves.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : If you control fewer than two Zombies, you won't get any tokens.
9/22/2011 : The number of Zombies you control is counted when the ability resolves. If you control multiple Endless Ranks of the Dead, the tokens you get when the first ability resolves will count for the subsequent abilities (if the tokens are still under your control at that time).

card.name: Essence of the Wild
card.ability: Creatures you control enter the battlefield as a copy of Essence of the Wild.
card.flavor: Wander too far into the wild and it may take you for its own.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : Creatures you control don't copy whether Essence of the Wild is tapped or untapped, whether it has any counters on it or any Auras and Equipment attached to it, or any non-copy effects that have changed its power, toughness, types, color, or so on.
9/22/2011 : Because creatures you control enter the battlefield as a copy of Essence of the Wild, any enters-the-battlefield triggered abilities printed on such creatures won't trigger.
9/22/2011 : Replacement effects that modify how a creature enters the battlefield are applied in the following order: first control-changing effects (such as Gather Specimens), then copy effects (such as the abilities of Essence of the Wild and Clone), then all other effects. This is a minor rules change to make Essence of the Wild and similar cards in the future work intuitively.
9/22/2011 : If a creature such as Clone is entering the battlefield under your control, there will be two copy effects to apply: the creature's own and Essence of the Wild's. No matter what order these effects are applied, the creature will be a copy of Essence of the Wild when it enters the battlefield.
9/22/2011 : Other enters-the-battlefield replacement abilities printed on the creature entering the battlefield won't be applied because the creature will already be Essence of the Wild at that point (and therefore it won't have those abilities). For example, a creature that normally enters the battlefield tapped will enter the battlefield as an untapped Essence of the Wild, and a creature that would normally enter the battlefield with counters on it will enter the battlefield as an Essence of the Wild with no counters.
9/22/2011 : External abilities may still affect how a creature enters the battlefield. For example, if your opponent controls Urabrask the Hidden, which reads, in part, "Creatures your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped," a creature entering the battlefield under your control will be a tapped Essence of the Wild.
9/22/2011 : If a creature such as Cryptoplasm that's already on the battlefield copies Essence of the Wild and modifies its own copy effect, that modification is also copied by creatures entering the battlefield under your control.
9/22/2011 : If you control more than one Essence of the Wild, creatures you control will enter the battlefield as a copy of the one whose copy effect you apply last.

card.name: Evil Twin
card.ability: You may have Evil Twin enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield except it gains "{U}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with the same name as this creature."
card.flavor: You can always tell the evil one by the dagger he's sticking in you.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : Evil Twin copies exactly what was printed on the original creature (unless that creature is copying something else or is a token; see below) and it gains the activated ability. It doesn't copy whether that creature is tapped or untapped, whether it has any counters on it or any Auras and Equipment attached to it, or any non-copy effects that have changed its power, toughness, types, color, or so on.
9/22/2011 : If you copy a double-faced creature, Evil Twin will be a copy of the face that's up when Evil Twin enters the battlefield. Because Evil Twin is not a double-faced card, it won't be able to transform.
9/22/2011 : If the chosen creature has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be zero.
9/22/2011 : If the chosen creature is copying something else (for example, if the chosen creature is another Evil Twin), then your Evil Twin enters the battlefield as whatever the chosen creature copied.
9/22/2011 : If the chosen creature is a token, Evil Twin copies the original characteristics of that token as stated by the effect that put the token onto the battlefield. Evil Twin is not a token.
9/22/2011 : Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the copied creature will trigger when Evil Twin enters the battlefield. Any "as [this creature] enters the battlefield" or "[this creature] enters the battlefield with" abilities of the chosen creature will also work.
9/22/2011 : If Evil Twin somehow enters the battlefield at the same time as another creature, Evil Twin can't become a copy of that creature. You may only choose a creature that's already on the battlefield.
9/22/2011 : You can choose not to copy anything. In that case, Evil Twin enters the battlefield as a 0/0 creature, and is probably put into the graveyard immediately.

card.name: Falkenrath Marauders
card.ability:
Flying, haste
Whenever Falkenrath Marauders deals combat damage to a player, put two +1/+1 counters on it.
card.flavor: No slinking in the dark for them, no luring whispers. They claim their prey in the speed and glory of the hunt.

card.name: Falkenrath Noble
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Falkenrath Noble or another creature dies, target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: "I often think on how excited they must feel to be chosen as my prey."

card.name: Feeling of Dread
card.ability:
Tap up to two target creatures.
Flashback {1}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: People only say "I'm sure it was nothing" when they're sure it was something.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : If Feeling of Dread targets two creatures, and one of them is an illegal target by the time Feeling of Dread resolves, the other creature will still be tapped.

card.name: Feral Ridgewolf
card.ability:
Trample
{1}{R}: Feral Ridgewolf gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The wolves no longer hunt just to feed. They kill for sport, or for some madness behind their eyes."
—Elmut, crossway watcher

card.name: Festerhide Boar
card.ability:
Trample
Morbid — Festerhide Boar enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it if a creature died this turn.
card.flavor:
"Bury your dead deep. The boars are hungriest while the corpse is still warm."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald

card.name: Fiend Hunter
card.ability:
When Fiend Hunter enters the battlefield, you may exile another target creature.
When Fiend Hunter leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : If Fiend Hunter leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and exile the targeted creature indefinitely.

card.name: Forbidden Alchemy
card.ability:
Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
Flashback {6}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : If you have fewer than four cards in your library, you'll look at all the cards there and put one into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

card.name: Fortress Crab
card.flavor: Unbreakable and unappetizing, the crab grows uninterrupted, sometimes to the size of a cottage and beyond.

card.name: Frightful Delusion
card.ability: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}. That player discards a card.
card.flavor: Whether he actually exists is in question, but the terror she feels is excruciatingly real.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : You must target a spell in order to cast Frightful Delusion. You can't cast it without a legal target just to make a player discard a card.
9/22/2011 : The player discards a card even if he or she pays {1}.

card.name: Full Moon's Rise
card.ability:
Werewolf creatures you control get +1/+0 and have trample.
Sacrifice Full Moon's Rise: Regenerate all Werewolf creatures you control.
card.flavor: Some lycanthropes wish they could abandon their weak human shapes and revel in the power of the wolf.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : In order to regenerate Werewolves involved in combat, you must sacrifice Full Moon's Rise before combat damage is assigned. This means they will lose the +1/+0 and trample bonuses before combat damage assignment.

card.name: Furor of the Bitten
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and attacks each turn if able.
card.flavor: Those who only believe themselves infected with lycanthropy can be as dangerous as those who really are.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : The enchanted creature's controller still chooses which player or planeswalker that creature attacks.
9/22/2011 : If there are multiple combat phases in a turn, the enchanted creature must attack only in the first one in which it's able to.
9/22/2011 : If, during its controller's declare attackers step, the enchanted creature is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or hasn't been under that player's control continuously since the turn began (and doesn't have haste), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having the creature attack, the player isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

card.name: Gallows Warden
card.ability:
Flying
Other Spirit creatures you control get +0/+1.
card.flavor: The spirit cares nothing for the crimes or triumphs of the slain. It shelters all beneath its stormy cloak.

card.name: Galvanic Juggernaut
card.ability:
Galvanic Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
Galvanic Juggernaut doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever another creature dies, untap Galvanic Juggernaut.

card.name: Garruk Relentless
card.ability:
When Garruk Relentless has two or fewer loyalty counters on him, transform him.
0: Garruk Relentless deals 3 damage to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to him.
0: Put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Garruk, the Veil-Cursed
card.ability:
+1: Put a 1/1 black Wolf creature token with deathtouch onto the battlefield.
-1: Sacrifice a creature. If you do, search your library for a creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
-3: Creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

card.name: Gatstaf Howler
card.ability:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Gatstaf Howler.

card.name: Gatstaf Shepherd
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Gatstaf Shepherd.

card.name: Gavony Township
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}{G}{W}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.
card.flavor:
"The protective wards of the church have weakened, and no one can tell us why. It's time to look to our own defenses."
—Gregel, militia leader

card.name: Geist of Saint Traft
card.ability:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Whenever Geist of Saint Traft attacks, put a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying onto the battlefield tapped and attacking. Exile that token at end of combat.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : You declare which player or planeswalker the token is attacking as you put it onto the battlefield. It doesn't have to be the same player or planeswalker Geist of Saint Traft is attacking.
9/22/2011 : Although the token is attacking, it was never declared as an attacking creature (for purposes of abilities that trigger whenever a creature attacks, for example).

card.name: Geistcatcher's Rig
card.ability: When Geistcatcher's Rig enters the battlefield, you may have it deal 4 damage to target creature with flying.
card.flavor: The rigs were outlawed except in Nephalia, where malign spirits are as plentiful as crazed inventors.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : The target creature with flying is chosen when the ability triggers and goes on the stack. You choose whether or not Geistcatcher's Rig will deal 4 damage to it when then ability resolves.

card.name: Geistflame
card.ability:
Geistflame deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: Innistrad pyromancers find their best raw materials in the fury of the dead.

card.name: Geist-Honored Monk
card.ability:
Vigilance
Geist-Honored Monk's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.
When Geist-Honored Monk enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : The ability that defines Geist-Honored Monk's power and toughness works in all zones, not just the battlefield.
9/22/2011 : As long as Geist-Honored Monk is on the battlefield, its second ability will count itself.

card.name: Ghost Quarter
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Ghost Quarter: Destroy target land. Its controller may search his or her library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle his or her library.
card.flavor: Deserted, but not uninhabited.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : The target land's controller gets to search for a basic land card even if that land wasn't destroyed by Ghost Quarter's ability. This may happen because the land is indestructible or because it was regenerated.
5/1/2006 : If you target Ghost Quarter with its own ability, the ability will be countered because its target is no longer on the battlefield. You won't get to search for a land card.
9/22/2011 : If the targeted land is an illegal target by the time Ghost Quarter's ability resolves, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. The land's controller won't get to search for a basic land card.

card.name: Ghostly Possession
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.

card.name: Ghoulcaller's Bell
card.ability: {T}: Each player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: The bell's chime heralds the rise of the unhallowed from the grave and the fall of their victims into the earth.

card.name: Ghoulcaller's Chant
card.ability: Choose one — Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand; or return two target Zombie cards from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor:
"The living are born small and weak. The dead rise ready to serve. The choice is obvious."
—Gisa, ghoulcaller of Gavony

card.name: Ghoulraiser
card.ability: When Ghoulraiser enters the battlefield, return a Zombie card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor:
"Come. Bring your brothers. Tonight, you feast on living flesh."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

card.name: Gnaw to the Bone
card.ability:
You gain 2 life for each creature card in your graveyard.
Flashback {2}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Grasp of Phantoms
card.ability:
Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
Flashback {7}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Grave Bramble
card.ability: Defender, protection from Zombies
card.flavor: Nature abhors a zombie.

card.name: Graveyard Shovel
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Target player exiles a card from his or her graveyard. If it's a creature card, you gain 2 life.
card.flavor: Thanks to Havengul's thriving illegal market for corpses, the shovel that interred a body during the day is usually the same one digging it out at night.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : The targeted player chooses which card to exile when the ability resolves.

card.name: Grimgrin, Corpse-Born
card.ability:
Grimgrin, Corpse-Born enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.
Sacrifice another creature: Untap Grimgrin and put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Whenever Grimgrin attacks, destroy target creature defending player controls, then put a +1/+1 counter on Grimgrin.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Grimgrin's last ability resolves, the entire ability is countered and none of its effects will occur. You won't put a +1/+1 counter on Grimgrin.
9/22/2011 : If Grimgrin's last ability resolves, but the targeted creature isn't destroyed (perhaps because it regenerated or is indestructible), you'll still put a +1/+1 on Grimgrin.
9/22/2011 : If the defending player controls no creatures when Grimgrin attacks, the last ability will be removed from the stack and have no effect.

card.name: Grimoire of the Dead
card.ability:
{1}, {T}, Discard a card: Put a study counter on Grimoire of the Dead.
{T}, Remove three study counters from Grimoire of the Dead and sacrifice it: Put all creature cards from all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control. They're black Zombies in addition to their other colors and types.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : "Creature cards" includes each card with the type creature, even if it has additional types, such as artifact.

card.name: Grizzled Outcasts
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Grizzled Outcasts.

card.name: Gruesome Deformity
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has intimidate. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
card.flavor: She wanted to inspire terror wherever she went. The demons happily granted her wish.

card.name: Gutter Grime
card.ability: Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, put a slime counter on Gutter Grime, then put a green Ooze creature token onto the battlefield with "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of slime counters on Gutter Grime."
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : The power and toughness of the Ooze tokens will constantly update as Gutter Grime accumulates slime counters.
9/22/2011 : If you control more than one Gutter Grime, each Ooze token remembers which one created it. The power and toughness of that Ooze will be equal to the number of slime counters on that Gutter Grime only.
9/22/2011 : If Gutter Grime leaves the battlefield, the power and toughness of each Ooze token it created will become 0. Unless another effect is raising its toughness above 0, each of these Ooze tokens will be put into its owner's graveyard the next time state-based actions are checked.

card.name: Hamlet Captain
card.ability: Whenever Hamlet Captain attacks or blocks, other Human creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "I would fear this fight, bloodsucker, were I alone."

card.name: Hanweir Watchkeep
card.ability:
Defender
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Hanweir Watchkeep.

card.name: Harvest Pyre
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Harvest Pyre, exile X cards from your graveyard.
Harvest Pyre deals X damage to target creature.
card.flavor: Corpses destroyed by fire form the most destructive geists.

card.name: Heartless Summoning
card.ability:
Creature spells you cast cost {2} less to cast.
Creatures you control get -1/-1.
card.flavor:
"They won't be winning any beauty pageants, but they'll do the trick."
—Enslow, ghoulcaller of Nephalia
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : The first ability doesn't reduce any colored mana requirements of the creature spell.

card.name: Heretic's Punishment
card.ability: {3}{R}: Choose target creature or player, then put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.Heretic's Punishment deals damage to that creature or player equal to the highest converted mana cost among those cards.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : If the targeted creature or player is an illegal target by the time the ability resolves, the entire ability will be countered. No cards will be put into your graveyard, and no damage will be dealt.
9/22/2011 : If you have two or fewer cards in your library when the ability resolves, all of them will be put into your graveyard. Heretic's Punishment will still deal damage equal to the highest converted mana cost among those cards.
9/22/2011 : The converted mana cost of a double-faced card in your graveyard is the converted mana cost of the front face.
9/22/2011 : If all three cards have a converted mana cost of 0, no damage will be dealt.
9/22/2011 : If a split card is put into your graveyard this way, consider each cost individually. For example, if Crime/Punishment, a split card with converted mana costs of 2 and 5, is put into your graveyard as well as a land and a card with converted mana cost 6, 6 damage is dealt because 6 is greater than 5 and greater than 2.

card.name: Hinterland Harbor
card.ability:
Hinterland Harbor enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Forest or an Island.
{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: In places where the sea meets the trees, it's easy to forget the darkness that rules most of Innistrad.

card.name: Hollowhenge Scavenger
card.ability: Morbid — When Hollowhenge Scavenger enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, you gain 5 life.
card.flavor: After werewolves slaughtered the citizenry of Hollowhenge, other creatures moved in.

card.name: Homicidal Brute
card.ability: At the beginning of your end step, if Homicidal Brute didn't attack this turn, tap Homicidal Brute, then transform it.

card.name: Howlpack Alpha
card.ability:
Each other creature you control that's a Werewolf or a Wolf gets +1/+1.
At the beginning of your end step, put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Howlpack Alpha.

card.name: Howlpack of Estwald
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Howlpack of Estwald.

card.name: Hysterical Blindness
card.ability: Creatures your opponents control get -4/-0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The panic is amusing, but the real fun comes when the spell passes and the villagers start looking for a scapegoat."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : Only creatures controlled by your opponent when Hysterical Blindness resolves will get -4/-0. Creatures that enter the battlefield or that an opponent gains control of later in the turn will be unaffected.
9/22/2011 : Hysterical Blindness's effect will continue to apply to a creature even if you (or a teammate) gains control of that creature later in the turn.

card.name: Infernal Plunge
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Infernal Plunge, sacrifice a creature.
Add {R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "Oh mighty Griselbrand, Scourge of the Heedless World, gladly I consume myself for thee!"
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
4/15/2013 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

card.name: Inquisitor's Flail
card.ability:
If equipped creature would deal combat damage, it deals double that damage instead.
If another creature would deal combat damage to equipped creature, it deals double that damage to equipped creature instead.
Equip {2}
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : If a creature is equipped with a second Inquisitor's Flail, combat damage dealt by and dealt to that creature will be multiplied by four. A third Inquisitor's Flail would multiply the combat damage by eight, and so on.
9/22/2011 : If you divide the combat damage dealt by the equipped creature, perhaps because the creature has trample or is dealing combat damage to multiple creatures, you'll divide the original amount and then double the results. For example, if a 5/5 creature with trample is blocked by a 2/2 creature, you can assign 2 damage to the blocker and 3 damage to the defending player. These amounts are then doubled to 4 and 6 damage, respectively. You can't double the damage to 10 first and then assign 2 to the creature and 8 to the player.

card.name: Insectile Aberration
card.ability: Flying

card.name: Instigator Gang
card.ability:
Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Instigator Gang.

card.name: Intangible Virtue
card.ability: Creature tokens you control get +1/+1 and have vigilance.
card.flavor: In life, they were a motley crew: farmers, lords, cutpurses, priests. In death, they are united in singular, benevolent purpose.

card.name: Into the Maw of Hell
card.ability: Destroy target land. Into the Maw of Hell deals 13 damage to target creature.
card.flavor: Few entrances lead to where demons and devils lurk. Unfortunately, they occasionally open new ones.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : Into the Maw of Hell targets both the land and the creature. You can only cast it if you can choose a legal target for both.
9/22/2011 : If one of Into the Maw of Hell's targets is illegal by the time it resolves, Into the Maw of Hell will still affect the remaining legal target. If both targets are illegal at this time, Into the Maw of Hell will be countered.

card.name: Invisible Stalker
card.ability:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Invisible Stalker is unblockable.
card.flavor: "All that concerns me is the vampires' sense of smell and those freezing Nephalian nights."

card.name: Ironfang
card.ability:
First strike
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Ironfang.

card.name: Isolated Chapel
card.ability:
Isolated Chapel enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Plains or a Swamp.
{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Not every church is a place of faith.

card.name: Kessig Cagebreakers
card.ability: Whenever Kessig Cagebreakers attacks, put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield tapped and attacking for each creature card in your graveyard.
card.flavor: "They put bars on these noble beasts and then wonder why werewolves target our towns."
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : You count the number of creature cards in your graveyard when the triggered ability resolves.
9/22/2011 : You declare which player or planeswalker each token is attacking as you put it onto the battlefield. It doesn't have to be the same player or planeswalker Kessig Cagebreakers is attacking.
9/22/2011 : Although the tokens are attacking, they were never declared as attacking creatures (for purposes of abilities that trigger whenever a creature attacks, for example).

card.name: Kessig Wolf
card.ability: {1}{R}: Kessig Wolf gains first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Don't be afraid when you hear the wolves howl. Be afraid when you don't hear them at all."
—Saint Trogen, the Slayer

card.name: Kessig Wolf Run
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{X}{R}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +X/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.
card.flavor: When a werewolf changes for the first time, that first howl is said to echo through the wilds till moonset.

card.name: Kindercatch
card.flavor: In the forest villages of Kessig, parents feed their children wormwood and other bitter herbs, hoping to make them less palatable to things that roam the night.

card.name: Krallenhorde Wantons
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Krallenhorde Wantons.

card.name: Kruin Outlaw
card.ability:
First strike
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Kruin Outlaw.

card.name: Laboratory Maniac
card.ability: If you would draw a card while your library has no cards in it, you win the game instead.
card.flavor: His mind whirled with grand plans, never thinking of what might happen if he were to succeed.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : If for some reason you can't win the game (because your opponent controls Platinum Angel, for example), you won't lose for having tried to draw a card from a library with no cards in it, because the draw was still replaced.

card.name: Lantern Spirit
card.ability:
Flying
{U}: Return Lantern Spirit to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Bound to the square where she died, she calls out to those in danger—usually scaring them straight into the peril she warns of.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : Only Lantern Spirit's controller may activate its ability.

card.name: Liliana of the Veil
card.ability:
+1: Each player discards a card.
-2: Target player sacrifices a creature.
-6: Separate all permanents target player controls into two piles. That player sacrifices all permanents in the pile of his or her choice.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : When the first ability resolves, first you choose a card to discard, then each other player in turn order chooses a card to discard, then all those cards are discarded simultaneously. No one sees what the other players are discarding before deciding which card to discard.
9/22/2011 : The player targeted by the second ability chooses which creature to sacrifice when the ability resolves. This ability doesn't target any creature.
9/22/2011 : When the third ability resolves, you put each permanent the player controls into one of the two piles. For example, you could put a creature into one pile and an Aura enchanting that creature into the other pile.
9/22/2011 : A pile can be empty. If the player chooses an empty pile, no permanents will be sacrificed.

card.name: Lord of Lineage
card.ability:
Flying
Other Vampire creatures you control get +2/+2.
{T}: Put a 2/2 black Vampire creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

card.name: Lost in the Mist
card.ability: Counter target spell. Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: The secrets she carried could have saved many lives, but they quietly drowned with her.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : Lost in the Mist targets both the spell and the permanent. You can only cast it if you can choose legal targets for both parts.
9/22/2011 : If one of Lost in the Mist's targets is illegal by the time it resolves, Lost in the Mist will still affect the remaining legal target. If both targets are illegal at this time, Lost in the Mist will be countered.

card.name: Ludevic's Abomination
card.ability: Trample

card.name: Ludevic's Test Subject
card.ability:
Defender
{1}{U}: Put a hatchling counter on Ludevic's Test Subject. Then if there are five or more hatchling counters on it, remove all of them and transform it.

card.name: Lumberknot
card.ability:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Whenever a creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Lumberknot.
card.flavor: Animated by geists fused in its oak, it hungers for more life to add to its core.

card.name: Make a Wish
card.ability: Return two cards at random from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: In Gavony wishing is taken as a sign of weakness, yet the wells usually brim with silver.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : Make a Wish isn't put into its owner's graveyard until it is finished resolving, so it can't be returned by its own effect.
9/22/2011 : The cards aren't randomly chosen until Make a Wish resolves.
9/22/2011 : If you only have one card in your graveyard when Make a Wish resolves, that card will be returned to your hand.

card.name: Makeshift Mauler
card.ability: As an additional cost to cast Makeshift Mauler, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
card.flavor:
"It always amazes me what perfectly good things people throw away."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

card.name: Manor Gargoyle
card.ability:
Defender
Manor Gargoyle is indestructible as long as it has defender.
{1}: Until end of turn, Manor Gargoyle loses defender and gains flying.
card.flavor: Nothing could break it but the fall.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : Lethal damage dealt to Manor Gargoyle while it's indestructible will stay marked on it that turn. If Manor Gargoyle stops being indestructible after having been dealt lethal damage earlier in the turn, it will be destroyed.

card.name: Manor Skeleton
card.ability:
Haste
{1}{B}: Regenerate Manor Skeleton.
card.flavor: Lungs dried to parchment wheeze blasphemies within a cage of bleached bone.

card.name: Markov Patrician
card.ability: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
card.flavor: Vampires of the Markov bloodline pride themselves on their exquisite taste in fashion, art, and "wine of the vein."

card.name: Mask of Avacyn
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +1/+2 and has hexproof. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Equip {3}
card.flavor: It hides the face and protects the soul.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : If Mask of Avacyn somehow becomes attached to a creature an opponent controls, that creature can't be the target of spells or abilities you control.

card.name: Mausoleum Guard
card.ability: When Mausoleum Guard dies, put two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: "Ghoulcallers trying to get in, geists trying to get out . . . . This duty is never dull."

card.name: Maw of the Mire
card.ability: Destroy target land. You gain 4 life.
card.flavor: As the chapel was dragged under, the bell in the tower rang until the murky depths forever silenced its toll.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : If the targeted land is an illegal target by the time Maw of the Mire resolves, it will be countered and none of its effects will occur. You won't gain 4 life.

card.name: Mayor of Avabruck
card.ability:
Other Human creatures you control get +1/+1.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Mayor of Avabruck.

card.name: Memory's Journey
card.ability:
Target player shuffles up to three target cards from his or her graveyard into his or her library.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : You don't have to target any cards when you cast Memory's Journey, but you must target a player.
9/22/2011 : If the player is an illegal target by the time Memory's Journey resolves, the spell will have no effect, even if the cards are still legal targets. This is because a spell can't make an illegal target (the player) perform any actions (such as shuffling his or her library).
9/22/2011 : Any of the targeted cards that are illegal targets by the time Memory's Journey resolves aren't shuffled into their owner's library.
9/22/2011 : If no cards were targeted by Memory's Journey or if all the targeted cards are illegal targets by the time Memory's Journey resolves, the targeted player will still shuffle his or her library.
9/22/2011 : If you cast Memory's Journey with flashback, it won't be in the graveyard when you choose targets. It can't target itself.

card.name: Mentor of the Meek
card.ability: Whenever another creature with power 2 or less enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.
card.flavor: "In these halls there is no pass or fail. Your true test comes with the first full moon."
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : You only check the power of the other creature when it enters the battlefield.--If it's 2 or less, the ability will trigger. Once the ability triggers, raising that creature's power above 2 won't affect that ability.--Similarly, reducing the creature's power to 2 or less after it enters the battlefield won't cause the ability to trigger.
9/22/2011 : Apply power bonuses from counters the creature enters the battlefield with and continuous effects like Mayor of Avabruck's when checking to see if Mentor of the Meek's ability will trigger.
9/22/2011 : You choose whether or not to pay {1} when the triggered ability resolves.

card.name: Merciless Predator
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Merciless Predator.

card.name: Midnight Haunting
card.ability: Put two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: The path back to the world of the living is murky and bewildering. A geist may not even realize that it's terrifying its own loved ones.

card.name: Mikaeus, the Lunarch
card.ability:
Mikaeus, the Lunarch enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mikaeus.
{T}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Mikaeus: Put a +1/+1 counter on each other creature you control.

card.name: Mindshrieker
card.ability:
Flying
{2}: Target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. Mindshrieker gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is that card's converted mana cost.

card.name: Mirror-Mad Phantasm
card.ability:
Flying
{1}{U}: Mirror-Mad Phantasm's owner shuffles it into his or her library. If that player does, he or she reveals cards from the top of that library until a card named Mirror-Mad Phantasm is revealed. The player puts that card onto the battlefield and all other cards revealed this way into his or her graveyard.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : You can only activate the ability if you control Mirror-Mad Phantasm, even if you don't own it.
9/22/2011 : If no card named Mirror-Mad Phantasm is revealed (possibly because it was a card copying Mirror-Mad Phantasm or it was a token), all cards from that library will be put into their owner's graveyard.
9/22/2011 : If another creature (such as Necrotic Ooze) gains Mirror-Mad Phantasm's activated ability, its owner reveals cards until he or she reveals a card named Mirror-Mad Phantasm.

card.name: Moan of the Unhallowed
card.ability:
Put two 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Flashback {5}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: For a ghoul, every village is a buffet and every disaster is a reunion.

card.name: Moldgraf Monstrosity
card.ability:
Trample
When Moldgraf Monstrosity dies, exile it, then return two creature cards at random from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor: The border between life and death is as thin as a layer of topsoil.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : If Moldgraf Monstrosity's ability can't exile it (perhaps because it's not still in the graveyard when the ability resolves), the two creature cards are still returned to the battlefield.
9/22/2011 : If two Moldgraf Monstrosities die simultaneously, the first ability to resolve could return the other Moldgraf Monstrosity to the battlefield. If it does, the second Moldgraf Monstrosity's ability won't exile it but it will return two more creature cards to the battlefield.

card.name: Moment of Heroism
card.ability: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
card.flavor: "My faith is stronger than fang, claw, or mindless hunger."
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : Multiple instances of lifelink on the same creature are redundant.

card.name: Moon Heron
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: The heron is the symbol of the archangel Avacyn. The fact that such spirits still fly gives the church hope that its founder may one day return.

card.name: Moonmist
card.ability: Transform all Humans. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by creatures other than Werewolves and Wolves. (Only double-faced cards can be transformed.)
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : Moonmist causes any double-faced Human to transform, not just Werewolves.
9/22/2011 : Whether or not a creature is a Werewolf or a Wolf is checked only as combat damage is dealt. If the creature isn't a Werewolf or a Wolf at that time, its combat damage will be prevented.
9/22/2011 : Moonmist will prevent combat damage dealt by a creature that isn't a Werewolf or a Wolf even if that creature wasn't on the battlefield (or was a Werewolf or a Wolf) when Moonmist resolved.

card.name: Moorland Haunt
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{W}{U}, {T}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

card.name: Morkrut Banshee
card.ability: Morbid — When Morkrut Banshee enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Let go your grudges, or risk wandering the bogs forever in a murderous rage."
—Hildin, priest of Avacyn
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : The morbid ability is mandatory. If there are no other creatures on the battlefield when the ability triggers (and a creature died this turn), the ability must target Morkrut Banshee itself.

card.name: Mulch
card.ability: Reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
card.flavor: The land knows no difference between the graves of commoners and nobles.

card.name: Murder of Crows
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever another creature dies, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.
card.flavor: Even more than carrion, they crave the last words of the dying.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : If you choose to draw a card, and that draw is replaced by another action, you'll still discard a card.
9/22/2011 : You can't do anything in between drawing a card and discarding a card, including casting the card you drew.

card.name: Naturalize
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor:
"Stone and thought fade into ruin. Only the wind in the leaves will endure."
—Tomb inscription

card.name: Nephalia Drownyard
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}{U}{B}, {T}: Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor:
"Some see a coastal disaster. I see a fully-stocked seagraf."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

card.name: Nevermore
card.ability:
As Nevermore enters the battlefield, name a nonland card.
The named card can't be cast.
card.flavor: "By the law of Avacyn, the following thoughts, words, and deeds are henceforth disallowed."
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : No one can cast spells or activate abilities between the time a card is named and the time that Nevermore's ability starts to work.
9/22/2011 : Spells with the chosen name that somehow happen to already be on the stack when Nevermore enters the battlefield are not affected by Nevermore's ability.
9/22/2011 : Although the named card can't be cast, it can still be put onto the battlefield by a spell or ability (if it's a permanent card).
9/22/2011 : If you want to name a split card, you must name both halves of it (for example, "Boom/Bust"). Neither side of that split card (Boom or Bust) can be cast.
9/22/2011 : If you want to name a double-faced card, remember to name the front face of that card. (The back face can't be cast anyway.)
9/22/2011 : The named card can be cast again once Nevermore leaves the battlefield.

card.name: Night Revelers
card.ability: Night Revelers has haste as long as an opponent controls a Human.
card.flavor: Vampires think of themselves as the indisputable nobility of Innistrad, able to do as they please. There are few who can prove them wrong.

card.name: Night Terrors
card.ability: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it. Exile that card.
card.flavor: Innistrad is a place where dreams invade the mind and mere shadows exact a terrible toll.

card.name: Nightbird's Clutches
card.ability:
Up to two target creatures can't block this turn.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: Shiny polished silver can ward off many creatures, but it attracts others.

card.name: Nightfall Predator
card.ability:
{R}, {T}: Nightfall Predator fights target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Nightfall Predator.

card.name: Olivia Voldaren
card.ability:
Flying
{1}{R}: Olivia Voldaren deals 1 damage to another target creature. That creature becomes a Vampire in addition to its other types. Put a +1/+1 counter on Olivia Voldaren.
{3}{B}{B}: Gain control of target Vampire for as long as you control Olivia Voldaren.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : If Olivia Voldaren deals lethal damage to a creature with its first activated ability, that creature will become a Vampire before dying.
9/22/2011 : If you activate Olivia Voldaren's last ability, and before that ability resolves you lose control of Olivia Voldaren, the ability will resolve with no effect. You won't gain control of the targeted Vampire.

card.name: One-Eyed Scarecrow
card.ability:
Defender
Creatures with flying your opponents control get -1/-0.
card.flavor: Farmhands and priests mutter curses at the ragged thing; it unnerves more than just the crows.

card.name: Orchard Spirit
card.ability: Orchard Spirit can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.
card.flavor:
"Pick not the rotten fruit, but neither touch the best. Leave those as an offering for our unseen guests."
—Radwick, farmer of Gatstaf

card.name: Parallel Lives
card.ability: If an effect would put one or more tokens onto the battlefield under your control, it puts twice that many of those tokens onto the battlefield instead.
card.flavor:
"There will come a time when the only prey left will be each other."
—Ulrich of Krallenhorde Pack
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : All of the tokens enter the battlefield simultaneously. They'll have the same name, color, type and subtype, abilities, power, toughness, and so on.
9/22/2011 : If the effect is putting more than one kind of token onto the battlefield, it'll put twice as many of each kind onto the battlefield. For example, if you cast Bestial Menace while controlling Parallel Lives, you'll put two Snake tokens, two Wolf tokens, and two Elephant tokens onto the battlefield.
9/22/2011 : If you control two Parallel Lives, then the number of tokens created is four times the original number. If you control three, then the number of tokens created is eight times the original number, and so on.
9/22/2011 : If the effect creating the tokens instructs you to do something with those tokens at a later time, like exiling them at the end of combat, you'll do that for all the tokens.

card.name: Paraselene
card.ability: Destroy all enchantments. You gain 1 life for each enchantment destroyed this way.
card.flavor:
"Moonlight has a way of showing all things as they truly are—for better or for worse."
—Zilla of Lambholt

card.name: Past in Flames
card.ability:
Each instant and sorcery card in your graveyard gains flashback until end of turn. The flashback cost is equal to its mana cost.
Flashback {4}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : Only instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard when Past in Flames resolves will gain flashback. Instant and sorcery cards that are put into your graveyard later in the turn, including the resolving Past in Flames, won't gain flashback.
9/22/2011 : If you cast an instant or sorcery with {X} in its mana cost this way, you still choose the value of X as part of casting the spell.
9/22/2011 : If an instant or sorcery card in your graveyard already has flashback, you may use either flashback ability to cast it from your graveyard.
9/22/2011 : You may pay any optional additional costs the spell has, such as kicker costs. You must pay any mandatory additional costs the spell has.

card.name: Pitchburn Devils
card.ability: When Pitchburn Devils dies, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: The ingenuity of goblins, the depravity of demons, and the smarts of sheep.

card.name: Prey Upon
card.ability: Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
card.flavor:
"You don't find many old werewolf hunters."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald
card.ruling: 7/1/2012 : If either or both targets are illegal when Prey Upon tries to resolve, no creature will deal or be dealt damage.

card.name: Purify the Grave
card.ability:
Exile target card from a graveyard.
Flashback {W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: Some priests speak in whispers of the Helvault, a silver prison of unpurged evils.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : Purify the Grave can't be used in response to a spell being cast with flashback or a spell that requires cards to exiled from a graveyard as an additional cost to try and counter the spell or prevent it from being cast.
9/22/2011 : If it's your turn, and you cast a spell with flashback from your hand, you'll have priority to cast that spell again using flashback before any other player has priority to cast Purify the Grave in order to remove that card from your graveyard.

card.name: Rage Thrower
card.ability: Whenever another creature dies, Rage Thrower deals 2 damage to target player.
card.flavor: "Some lament these haunted times, but I'm a geistflame-tank-half-full kind of person."
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : If Rage Thrower dies at the same time as another creature, its ability will trigger.

card.name: Rakish Heir
card.ability: Whenever a Vampire you control deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor: "If you're not having fun, what's the point of living forever?"

card.name: Rally the Peasants
card.ability:
Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor:
"If you must go out at night, bring a mob."
—Master of the Elgaud Cathars
