card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : Only creatures you control when Rally the Peasants resolves will be affected. Creatures that enter the battlefield or that you gain control of later in the turn will not.

card.name: Rampaging Werewolf
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Rampaging Werewolf.

card.name: Ranger's Guile
card.ability: Target creature you control gets +1/+1 and gains hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
card.flavor: In the remote corners of Kessig, protection is found in secret powers unknown to the Church of Avacyn.

card.name: Reaper from the Abyss
card.ability:
Flying
Morbid — At the beginning of each end step, if a creature died this turn, destroy target non-Demon creature.
card.flavor: "Avacyn has deserted you. I welcome your devotion in her stead."
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : The morbid ability is mandatory. If you control the only non-Demon creature when the ability triggers, you must choose it as the target.

card.name: Rebuke
card.ability: Destroy target attacking creature.
card.flavor:
"No one chooses to be stitched together into a skaab. If it could speak, it would beg for its own destruction."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

card.name: Reckless Waif
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Reckless Waif.

card.name: Riot Devils
card.flavor: Devils are demons' unearthly desires made flesh. Let loose on the world, they satisfy their mad craving for destruction in a whirlwind of chaos.

card.name: Rolling Temblor
card.ability:
Rolling Temblor deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.
Flashback {4}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: When demons open a path to your front door, it's time to move.

card.name: Rooftop Storm
card.ability: You may pay {0} rather than pay the mana cost for Zombie creature spells you cast.
card.flavor:
"Let those idiot priests tremble! A new era in unlife begins here and now. Oglor, raise the lightning vane!"
—Stitcher Geralf
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : You must still pay any mandatory additional costs, such as exiling a creature card from your graveyard for Makeshift Mauler.
9/22/2011 : The mana cost and converted mana cost of the spell are unchanged. Rooftop Storm only changes what you pay.

card.name: Rotting Fensnake
card.flavor: Its venom sacs are long gone, but its crushing strength is somehow greater than ever.

card.name: Runechanter's Pike
card.ability:
Equipped creature has first strike and gets +X/+0, where X is the number of instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard.
Equip {2}
card.flavor: As sharp as its bearer's words of faith.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : The value of X is constantly updated as instant cards and sorcery cards are put into or removed from your graveyard.

card.name: Runic Repetition
card.ability: Return target exiled card with flashback you own to your hand.
card.flavor: "What some call obsession, I call the quest for perfection."
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : The card could have been exiled for any reason, not just because it was cast using flashback.
9/22/2011 : An effect that gives flashback to an instant or sorcery card in your graveyard stops applying once that card has left the stack. The card won't have flashback while exiled and can't be the target of Runic Repetition (unless it naturally has flashback).
9/22/2011 : A card that's exiled face down doesn't have any characteristics or abilities, so it can't be the target of Runic Repetition.

card.name: Scourge of Geier Reach
card.ability: Scourge of Geier Reach gets +1/+1 for each creature your opponents control.
card.flavor: Stensian villagers mourned the loss of human life. Thraben vampire slayers mourned the loss of living wood.

card.name: Screeching Bat
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {2}{B}{B}. If you do, transform Screeching Bat.

card.name: Selfless Cathar
card.ability: {1}{W}, Sacrifice Selfless Cathar: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "If I fail to offer myself, we will surely be overrun. My fate would be the same."
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : You can activate Selfless Cathar's ability even if you control no other creatures.
9/22/2011 : Only creatures you control when Selfless Cathar's ability resolves will be affected. Creatures that enter the battlefield or that you gain control of later in the turn will not.

card.name: Selhoff Occultist
card.ability: Whenever Selhoff Occultist or another creature dies, target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: "The mist whispers to those who know it to be more than a mundane fog."

card.name: Sensory Deprivation
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -3/-0.
card.flavor: They call it "stitcher's anesthesia," a spell to deaden the senses while the mad doctors begin their grisly work.

card.name: Sever the Bloodline
card.ability:
Exile target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature.
Flashback {5}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : Only creatures on the battlefield will be exiled. In other zones, they're "creature cards," not "creatures."
9/22/2011 : A double-faced creature only has the name of the face that's up. For example, if Village Ironsmith is targeted by Sever the Bloodline, Ironfang wouldn't be exiled.
9/22/2011 : If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Sever the Bloodline resolves, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. No creatures will be exiled.
9/22/2011 : Unless a token is a copy of another creature or was explicitly given a name by the effect that created it, its name is the creature types it was given when it was created. For example, the Zombie tokens created by Army of the Damned and by Cellar Door are all named "Zombie."

card.name: Sharpened Pitchfork
card.ability:
Equipped creature has first strike.
As long as equipped creature is a Human, it gets +1/+1.
Equip {1}
card.flavor: Not everyone can have a sword of blessed silver. Not everyone needs one, either.

card.name: Shimmering Grotto
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"This is the price of being last in the food chain. We must keep our places of beauty hidden away instead of displayed for all to see."
—Hildin, priest of Avacyn

card.name: Silent Departure
card.ability:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Flashback {4}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: The same magic that lets geists pass through our realm can force them out of it.

card.name: Silverchase Fox
card.ability: {1}{W}, Sacrifice Silverchase Fox: Exile target enchantment.
card.flavor:
"Be careful in your hunt. The clever little creature can steal your wards and lead you right into the werewolf's den."
—Britta, midwife of Gatstaf

card.name: Silver-Inlaid Dagger
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +2/+0.
As long as equipped creature is a Human, it gets an additional +1/+0.
Equip {2}
card.flavor: Magical etchings turned a whittler's tool into a wolfhunter's weapon.

card.name: Skaab Goliath
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Skaab Goliath, exile two creature cards from your graveyard.
Trample
card.flavor:
"Three heads, six arms, and some armor grafts are better than . . . the normal numbers of those things."
—Stitcher Geralf

card.name: Skaab Ruinator
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Skaab Ruinator, exile three creature cards from your graveyard.
Flying
You may cast Skaab Ruinator from your graveyard.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : Skaab Ruinator is on the stack when you pay its costs. It can't be exiled to pay for itself.
9/22/2011 : You must exile three creature cards from your graveyard no matter what zone you're casting Skaab Ruinator from.

card.name: Skeletal Grimace
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has "{B}: Regenerate this creature."
card.flavor:
"And then I realized we all have skeletons on the inside. Why wait until the bodies are dead to control them?"
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

card.name: Skirsdag Cultist
card.ability: {R}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Skirsdag Cultist deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: "Within blood is life. Within life is fire. Within fire is the path to our masters' glory!"

card.name: Skirsdag High Priest
card.ability: Morbid — {T}, Tap two untapped creatures you control: Put a 5/5 black Demon creature token with flying onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only if a creature died this turn.
card.flavor: "Thraben's pleas fall on deaf ears. Ours do not."
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : Unlike Skirsdag High Priest itself, the two other creatures you tap to activate the ability aren't required to have been under your control continuously since the beginning of your most recent turn.

card.name: Slayer of the Wicked
card.ability: When Slayer of the Wicked enters the battlefield, you may destroy target Vampire, Werewolf, or Zombie.
card.flavor: You don't want to see his trophy room.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : If you control the only Vampire, Werewolf, or Zombie, you must target it with Slayer of the Wicked's ability. You choose whether or not to destroy the target when the ability resolves.

card.name: Smite the Monstrous
card.ability: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
card.flavor: Though the old holy wards and roadside shrines have begun to fail, faith in Avacyn still holds true power.

card.name: Snapcaster Mage
card.ability:
Flash
When Snapcaster Mage enters the battlefield, target instant or sorcery card in your graveyard gains flashback until end of turn. The flashback cost is equal to its mana cost. (You may cast that card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : If the targeted instant or sorcery card already has flashback, you may use either flashback ability to cast it from your graveyard.
10/1/2012 : You can’t pay other alternative costs of a card you’re casting from your graveyard using flashback. For example, if the instant or sorcery has an overload cost, you can’t pay that cost.

card.name: Somberwald Spider
card.ability:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Morbid — Somberwald Spider enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it if a creature died this turn.
card.flavor: Stensian vampires encourage spiders near their manors so they can rob the webs.

card.name: Spare from Evil
card.ability: Creatures you control gain protection from non-Human creatures until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"As long as we can utter a prayer or lift a weapon, we have the power to fight back."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : Only creatures you control when Spare from Evil resolves will be affected. Creatures that enter the battlefield or that you gain control of later in the turn won't be.
9/22/2011 : A "non-Human creature" is any creature that doesn't have the creature type Human. A creature that is a Human in addition to other creature types is not a non-Human creature.

card.name: Spectral Flight
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.
card.flavor:
"The church looks down on binding spirits into armor, but now I can look down on them."
—Dierk, geistmage

card.name: Spectral Rider
card.ability: Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
card.flavor: Never a word. Never a warning. Only the sound of hoofbeats along the crossways, and the screams of the avenged.

card.name: Spider Spawning
card.ability:
Put a 1/2 green Spider creature token with reach onto the battlefield for each creature card in your graveyard.
Flashback {6}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : The number of creature cards in your graveyard is counted when Spider Spawning resolves.

card.name: Spidery Grasp
card.ability: Untap target creature. It gets +2/+4 and gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor:
"Nobody's seen the Lady of Videns for years. Poor dear, no companions at all in that old castle."
—Yonda of Gavony
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : Spidery Grasp can target a creature that's already untapped. It will still get +2/+4 and gain reach.

card.name: Splinterfright
card.ability:
Trample
Splinterfright's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : The ability that defines Splinterfright's power and toughness works in all zones, not just the battlefield. If Splinterfright is in your graveyard, it will count itself.
9/22/2011 : If Splinterfright's controller has only one card in his or her library, he or she puts that card into his or her graveyard.

card.name: Stalking Vampire
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {2}{B}{B}. If you do, transform Stalking Vampire.

card.name: Stensia Bloodhall
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{3}{B}{R}, {T}: Stensia Bloodhall deals 2 damage to target player.
card.flavor: The revelry ends when the supply of fresh ingenues runs dry.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : Like other lands, Stensia Bloodhall is colorless. The damage it deals is from a colorless source, even though activating its ability requires colored mana.

card.name: Stitched Drake
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Stitched Drake, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Flying
card.flavor:
"The best skaab are more powerful and more beautiful than the sum of their parts."
—Stitcher Geralf

card.name: Stitcher's Apprentice
card.ability: {1}{U}, {T}: Put a 2/2 blue Homunculus creature token onto the battlefield, then sacrifice a creature.
card.flavor: "Oglor create life, Oglor take it away. Oglor god! . . . until Master return."
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : You can't do anything in between the Homunculus token being created and having to sacrifice a creature.
9/22/2011 : If you control no creatures when the ability resolves, you'll put the Homunculus token onto the battlefield and immediately sacrifice it.

card.name: Stony Silence
card.ability: Activated abilities of artifacts can't be activated.
card.flavor:
Let moss grow over gargoyles
—Gavony saying meaning
"forget painful memories"
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords, such as equip, are activated abilities; they have colons in their reminder text.
9/22/2011 : Mana abilities of artifacts also can't be activated.
9/22/2011 : Triggered abilities and static abilities of artifacts are unaffected. Also, activated abilities (such as cycling or unearth) of artifact cards not on the battlefield are unaffected.

card.name: Stromkirk Noble
card.ability:
Stromkirk Noble can't be blocked by Humans.
Whenever Stromkirk Noble deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor: "A responsible king walks among his subjects."

card.name: Stromkirk Patrol
card.ability: Whenever Stromkirk Patrol deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor: "You'd best move along, human. Our palates are far less discerning than our master's."

card.name: Sturmgeist
card.ability:
Flying
Sturmgeist's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
Whenever Sturmgeist deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : The ability that defines Sturmgeist's power and toughness works in all zones, not just the battlefield.

card.name: Sulfur Falls
card.ability:
Sulfur Falls enters the battlefield tapped unless you control an Island or a Mountain.
{T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Skirsdag cultists meet behind a waterfall's curtain and plot with demonic forces.

card.name: Terror of Kruin Pass
card.ability:
Double strike
Each Werewolf you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Terror of Kruin Pass.

card.name: Think Twice
card.ability:
Draw a card.
Flashback {2}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: "Either I know just the spell I need, or I'm about to."

card.name: Thraben Militia
card.ability: Trample

card.name: Thraben Purebloods
card.flavor:
"I've learned to trust my dogs' instincts. When they're calm, I'm calm. And when they get nervous, I get my crossbow."
—Hinrik of House Cecani

card.name: Thraben Sentry
card.ability:
Vigilance
Whenever another creature you control dies, you may transform Thraben Sentry.

card.name: Tormented Pariah
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Tormented Pariah.

card.name: Traitorous Blood
card.ability: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap it. It gains trample and haste until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"I can make you dance to my tune like a puppet, your very blood eager to obey."
—Olivia Voldaren
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : Traitorous Blood can target any creature, even one that's tapped or one you already control.
9/22/2011 : Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

card.name: Travel Preparations
card.ability:
Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.
Flashback {1}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: Visiting a shrine at the start of a journey makes the traveler more likely to finish it.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : You can't target the same creature twice to put two +1/+1 counters on it.
9/22/2011 : If Travel Preparations targets two creatures, and one of them is an illegal target by the time Travel Preparations resolves, you'll still put a +1/+1 counter on the other creature.

card.name: Traveler's Amulet
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice Traveler's Amulet: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: The rider set off into the eerie mist, swaddled in armor and laden with amulets.

card.name: Tree of Redemption
card.ability:
Defender
{T}: Exchange your life total with Tree of Redemption's toughness.
card.flavor: The executioner's tree in Thraben Cathedral holds the power to absolve more than the souls of the hanged.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : When the ability resolves, Tree of Redemption's toughness will become your former life total and you will gain or lose an amount of life necessary so that your life total equals Tree of Redemption's former toughness. Other effects that interact with life gain or life loss will interact with this effect accordingly.
9/22/2011 : Any toughness-modifying effects, counters, Auras, or Equipment will apply after its toughness is set to your former life total. For example, say Tree of Redemption is enchanted with Spectral Flight (which makes it 2/15) and your life total is 7. After the exchange, Tree of Redemption would be a 2/9 creature (its toughness became 7, which was then modified by Spectral Flight) and your life total would be 15.
9/22/2011 : If Tree of Redemption isn't on the battlefield when the ability resolves, the exchange can't happen and the ability will have no effect.

card.name: Trepanation Blade
card.ability:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, defending player reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a land card. The creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each card revealed this way. That player puts the revealed cards into his or her graveyard.
Equip {2}
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : The land card is counted when calculating the bonus, and it will be put into the graveyard with the other revealed cards.
9/22/2011 : If the equipped creature is attacking a planeswalker in any game except a Two-Headed Giant game, the controller of the planeswalker is the defending player.
9/22/2011 : If the equipped creature is attacking in a Two-Headed Giant game, the controller of the attacking creature chooses one of the two defending players, even if the creature is attacking a planeswalker.

card.name: Tribute to Hunger
card.ability: Target opponent sacrifices a creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
card.flavor: Marella was delighted. The ball had attracted so many suitors for her daughter, including that handsome stranger. She wondered where the two were now . . . .
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : The amount of life you gain is equal to the creature's toughness as it last existed on the battlefield.

card.name: Typhoid Rats
card.ability: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
card.flavor: Kidnappers caught in Havengul are given two choices: languish in prison or become rat catchers. The smart ones go to prison.

card.name: Ulvenwald Mystics
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Ulvenwald Mystics.

card.name: Ulvenwald Primordials
card.ability:
{G}: Regenerate Ulvenwald Primordials.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Ulvenwald Primordials.

card.name: Unbreathing Horde
card.ability:
Unbreathing Horde enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each other Zombie you control and each Zombie card in your graveyard.
If Unbreathing Horde would be dealt damage, prevent that damage and remove a +1/+1 counter from it.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : Only one +1/+1 counter will be removed, no matter how much damage is prevented.
9/22/2011 : If Unbreathing Horde has no +1/+1 counters on it (but its toughness is raised above 0 by another effect), any damage dealt to it will still be prevented, even though no counter will be removed.
9/22/2011 : If Unbreathing Horde enters the battlefield from a graveyard, it will count itself when determining how many +1/+1 counters it enters the battlefield with.

card.name: Unburial Rites
card.ability:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Flashback {3}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: All crave the Blessed Sleep. Few receive it.

card.name: Undead Alchemist
card.ability:
If a Zombie you control would deal combat damage to a player, instead that player puts that many cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Whenever a creature card is put into an opponent's graveyard from his or her library, exile that card and put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : If you control multiple Undead Alchemists, the multiple replacement abilities will have no added effect. Combat damage dealt to a player by a Zombie you control will be replaced only once with cards being put into that player's graveyard.
9/22/2011 : Whenever a creature card is put into an opponent's graveyard from his or her library, the triggered ability of each Undead Alchemist you control will trigger. The first such ability to resolve will exile that creature card and create a Zombie token. Subsequent abilities won't exile the creature card, but each will create another Zombie token.

card.name: Unholy Fiend
card.ability: At the beginning of your end step, you lose 1 life.

card.name: Unruly Mob
card.ability: Whenever another creature you control dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Unruly Mob.
card.flavor:
"Who says werewolves are the only ones who can hunt as a pack?"
—Kolman, elder of Gatstaf
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : If Unruly Mob and another creature you control die simultaneously (perhaps because they were both attacking or blocking), Unruly Mob will die before its triggered ability resolves. It can't be saved by the +1/+1 counter that would have been put on it.

card.name: Urgent Exorcism
card.ability: Destroy target Spirit or enchantment.
card.flavor:
"To show geists pity is to prolong their agonies. Whether they know it or not, they seek the Blessed Sleep, and we are to give it to them."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch

card.name: Vampire Interloper
card.ability:
Flying
Vampire Interloper can't block.
card.flavor: He listens to every heartbeat, deciding which one of hundreds he will stop.

card.name: Vampiric Fury
card.ability: Vampire creatures you control get +2/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor: Many peasants secretly admire vampires' glamour and elegance—until they witness a moment of pure bloodlust.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : Only Vampires you control when Vampiric Fury resolves will receive the bonus. Creatures that enter the battlefield, that you gain control of later in the turn, or that become Vampires later in the turn won't be affected.

card.name: Victim of Night
card.ability: Destroy target non-Vampire, non-Werewolf, non-Zombie creature.
card.flavor:
"Do not touch a drop. Not yet. I want to watch this so-called slayer's last crisis of faith."
—Olivia Voldaren

card.name: Village Bell-Ringer
card.ability:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Village Bell-Ringer enters the battlefield, untap all creatures you control.
card.flavor: "Priests, hunters, slayers—to arms! The enemy approaches!"
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : Untapping an attacking creature doesn't remove it from combat.

card.name: Village Cannibals
card.ability: Whenever another Human creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Village Cannibals.
card.flavor: Some have endured the horrors of Innistrad by becoming the worst monsters of all.

card.name: Village Ironsmith
card.ability:
First strike
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Village Ironsmith.

card.name: Villagers of Estwald
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Villagers of Estwald.

card.name: Voiceless Spirit
card.ability: Flying, first strike
card.flavor:
"I'd rather take on a neckbiter or moonhowler any day. Oh well, looks like I'm going to end up parrying with empty air half the night."
—Saint Trogen, the Slayer

card.name: Walking Corpse
card.flavor:
"Is it hopeless? When wave upon wave of our dead return as mindless flesh-eaters to claw upon Thraben's walls? We're too busy cutting them down to indulge ourselves in such philosophical foppery."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch

card.name: Wildblood Pack
card.ability:
Trample
Attacking creatures you control get +3/+0.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Wildblood Pack.

card.name: Witchbane Orb
card.ability:
When Witchbane Orb enters the battlefield, destroy all Curses attached to you.
You have hexproof. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control, including Aura spells.)

card.name: Wooden Stake
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0.
Whenever equipped creature blocks or becomes blocked by a Vampire, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : The Vampire is destroyed before any combat damage is dealt.

card.name: Woodland Cemetery
card.ability:
Woodland Cemetery enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Swamp or a Forest.
{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Farmers cut the trees and buried their dead. The dead rose up and killed the farmers. The trees grew back and strangled the dead.

card.name: Woodland Sleuth
card.ability: Morbid — When Woodland Sleuth enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, return a creature card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: "Whatever did this is near. Death reversion has not yet occurred. Be alert!"
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : The creature card isn't chosen at random until the ability resolves.
9/22/2011 : Woodland Sleuth could die in response to its own morbid ability. If this happens, the ability could return Woodland Sleuth to its owner's hand.

card.name: Wreath of Geists
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +X/+X, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
card.flavor: Before you travel the woods of Kessig, first get permission from those who died trying.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : The value of X is constantly updated as creature cards are put into or removed from your graveyard.
